This demo should have been shown at [Enlight`97](https://www.enlight.ru/enlight/) demo party. Unfortunately, due to technical reasons second day of the party has been canceled, and demo was not shown.

This was the last demo released by our group. After that I lost interest to demo making and moved to game development.

Modern PC is 1000x faster that one used to write an intro. You can execute intro in the emulator by double clicking on MSDOS icon.

items.name: 2019-03 JS1k Lost In A Cave
items.desc:
**Lost In A Cave**
Javascript 1024 bytes intro.
**First place at JS1k 2019** [https://js1k.com/2019-x/](https://js1k.com/2019-x/)

Double click on javascript file to execute.

*Unfortunatelly intro does not work on JS1k website in Chrome anymore due to canvas API changes in Chrome*.

In 1996-1997, I, Roman Lut (aka Hax), together with Eugene Babich (aka Dem), worked as a demo group called **‚ÄúThe Nephilims.‚Äù** During that time, we created several demos and participated in demoscene events.

Today, running these demos requires almost a ‚Äústone-age‚Äù setup, as most of them depend on pure DOS and are affected by the well-known Borland **‚ÄúRuntime Error 200‚Äù** issue.

Fortunately, modern PCs are more than 1000 times faster than the machines we used back then. Thanks to this, the original demos can now be run directly in a web browser using a [DOS emulator](https://js-dos.com/v7/build/docs/).

Enter a folder and double click on MS-DOS icon to launch demo/intro.

items.name: Electronics
1994-01 Tandy Sound emulator for Poisk1
items.desc:
**Tandy Sound Emulator**

Tandy Sound is a rare sound card, available on PCjr and Tandy computers. It has 3 sound channes + one noise channel. Many old games support Tandy sound. Thanks to it‚Äôs simplicity, Tandy sound can be emulated with simple hardware part, based on i8053 chip, and simple software.

Date: 1994
Platform: DOS
Language: Pure asm

items.name: 1996-01 HW Sound blaster 1 0 emulator
items.desc:
**HW Sound blaster 1.0 emulator**
There was a time when Sound blaster was so high-tech and cost so much, that rare people own it. Using my knowledge of digital electronics, I developed and built Sound blaster 1.0 compatible card. It has about 30 chips (just a logical elements, no microcontroller) and emulated digital part of Sound Blaster 1.0.

**Date:** 1996
**Platform:** DOS
*Comments: Unfortunatelly, schematics and firmware have been lost.*

Actually, emulating Sound Blater 1.0 is easy. There are only two output modes: immediate byte-to-DAC output and DMA output. Also care must be taken to emulate SB responce behaviour so games could detect that SB is  resent. Since all games used standart library from Creative, SB detection pattern was known and was hard-wired into emulator. By using simple trigger-switching, it was possible to emulate SB without microcontroller. I also seen microcontroller-based SB emulator  from other author somewhere in the net.

items.desc: This folder contains my DIY electronics and robotics projects and publications.

items.name: Hobby projects
1992-03 DOSEMU
items.desc:
Ôªø**DOSEMU**

**Date:** 1992-1993
**Platform:** Poisk-1, NO OS !
**Language:** Pure 8086 Assembler

The low-cost IBM-compatible PC called **POISK-1**, developed by the Ukrainian company **ElectronMash** in 1992, became a memorable milestone in the lives of many people. Its significance is comparable to the emergence of the ZX Spectrum series.

**Poisk-1** has modularized architecture. Base module has been limited to CPU, RAM and integrated Video Card. All software were loaded from tape recorder. During a year I ported about 30 games to cassette. When loaded from cassette, there is no operating system ‚Äì only pure BIOS. INT21 and other interrupts should be emulated by a small stub ‚Äì DOSEMU. DOSEMU did the good job with a lot of games, and even made possible making savegame to cassette ‚Äì f.e. with ELITE.

Cassetes and source code was lost üôÅ

items.name: 1993-06 HyperBIOS for Poisk-1
items.desc:
Ôªø**HyperBIOS**

**Date:** 1993
**Platform:** POISK-1, DOS
**Language:** 8086 Assembler


The low-cost IBM-compatible PC called **POISK-1**, developed by the Ukrainian company **ElectronMash** in 1992, became a memorable milestone in the lives of many people. Its significance is comparable to the emergence of the ZX Spectrum series.

This was my first home computer. After extensive experimentation, I developed a resident program that replaced the original BIOS and:
- Made screen output 2-3 times faster
- Solved many compatibility issues
- Remapped the keyboard layout for better usability
- Added support for a low-cost joystick interface that I designed myself

Program became very popular, many users considered it the most useful program for this PC üôÇ

*The POISK-1 had only two native graphics modes: 320x200x with 4 colors and 640x200 with 2 colors. All standard text modes were emulated by the BIOS by rendering characters within these graphics modes. Direct writes to video memory were intercepted by the BIOS (triggering INT 1), allowing the system to remain compatible with software that accessed video memory directly.*

*HyperBIOS replaced both the INT 10 and INT 1 handlers with highly optimized assembly code, increasing screen output speed by 2-3 times. Performance could have been even better if HyperBIOS had been placed in ROM, which was 2-3 times faster than RAM on this system.*

The joystick interface wiring diagram and source code have unfortunately been lost üôÅ

items.name: 1994-04 SlowPlay STM Player
items.desc:
**SlowPlay**

**Date:** 1994
**Platform:** DOS
**Language:** Pure 8086 Assembler

items.name: 2003-01 SendToPDA
items.desc:
Ôªø**SendToPDA**

**Date:** 2003
**Platform:** Windows XP
**Language:** Delphi 6.0

In 2003, Android did not exist, and Palm PCs were popular. These were small, handheld devices capable of running applications and were controlled by the Palm OS operating system.

This folder contains a GUI for the iSiloX converter. It adds a ‚ÄúSend to PDA‚Äù option to the right-click context menu for HTM, HTML, TXT, RTF, and DOC files. The tool automatically handles all dialog steps, allowing you to send files to a Palm device in just two clicks.

**Palm PDAs** are completely outdated now.

items.name: 2003-02 FlyCamera 3dsMax Plugin
items.desc:
**FlyCamera**

Simple 3DS Max plugin for navigating with cursor keys in 3DS MAX viewport.

**Date:** 2003
**Platform:** Windows
**Language:** 3DS MAX script

items.name: 2003-08 ReadManiac
items.desc:
**ReadManiac**

**Date:** 2003-2006  
**Platform:** JAVA-enabled phones (J2ME MIDP1.0, 2.0)  
**Language:** J2ME, Delphi

In 2002, mobile phones became capable of running small Java applications.
Naturally, I couldn‚Äôt miss the opportunity to create software for mobile devices. When the first Java-enabled phones appeared on the market, I bought an ‚Äúearly bird‚Äù Siemens SL42 and began developing a book reader application.
ReadManiac is a book reader MIDlet for mobile phones. It allows users to search, download, and read books on virtually any Java-enabled device.
The first version was compatible only with the SL42, but it quickly evolved into a large, full-featured, and user-friendly application that supported most J2ME-enabled phones.
**In 2006, ReadManiac won 3rd place in the JavaKonkurs competition, sponsored by Sun Microsystems.**
Today, the era of Java-enabled phones has ended. This folder contains an archive of the ReadManiac installation files, source code, and website.

items.name: 2004-02 SceneMainTool 3dsMax Plugin
items.desc:
Ôªø**SceneMainTool**

**Date**: 2004
**Platform**: Windows, 3ds MAX 4.x, 5.x, 6.x
**Language**: C++

This tool creates a scene root dummy with a single click.

In 3ds Max, moving or rotating an entire scene is not as simple as selecting all objects, due to hierarchies, Physique-linked meshes, and link constraint controllers. These dependencies make global transformations difficult.

To solve this, animators usually create a root node that controls all scene objects (except Physique meshes and nodes with link constraints) and then move or rotate the scene using this root node. This plugin automatically creates such a root node in seconds.

items.name: 2005-10 Using webcamera as virtual graphics tablet
Using webcamera as virtual graphics tablet (translated to english)
2006-01 3D Ripper DX
items.desc:
**3D Ripper DX**

**Date:** 2006
**Platform:** Windows
**Language:** C++, Assembly

3D Ripper DX captures frame geometry, textures, and shaders from DirectX 6.0-9.0 applications by intercepting DirectX API calls.

The complete frame geometry is reconstructed and imported into 3ds Max, allowing rendered scenes to be inspected and analyzed in detail.

Originally designed as an analysis and debugging tool for programmers, it unexpectedly gained widespread popularity among 3D artists due to its ability to reconstruct full scenes inside 3ds Max.

**Note: This project has not been maintained since 2010 due to a lack of interest. It requires Windows XP to run. Because it uses aggressive code injection techniques, it may be falsely flagged as malware by antivirus software.**

items.name: 2007 01 hxMap
items.desc:
**Date:** 2007
**Platform:** WM2005
**Language:** C++, Delphi 2.0

**hxMap** is Windows Mobile 2005 smartphone application for viewing large map images.

The only available map is Kiev, Ukraine.

App supports GPS position requests from GlabalSat TR-101 personal GPS tracker.

Windows Mobile 2005 is completely outdated now.

items.name: 2007-07 hxGrid Distibuted Computing Library
2007-07 hxGrid Distributed Computing In Small Office
Distributed Computing in Small and Medium Offices (translated to english)

items.desc:
**hxGrid**

**Date**: 2007
**Platform**: Windows
**Language**: Delphi, C++

**hxGrid** is a distributed computing library designed for small office environments. It enables the transparent use of idle processing time on Windows XP, Vista, and Windows 7 workstations, without interfering with normal user activity.

The **ATI NormalMapper** tool was adapted for hxGrid, resulting in up to a 20x performance improvement. The library was also used in the **xNormal** tool (http://www.xnormal.net/
).

**hxGrid** is written in Delphi and can be used from both Delphi and C++, with example projects included.

The library is known to have been used by several game development companies to distribute and accelerate game level compilation tasks.

*Note: This project is no longer maintained due to a lack of interest.*

items.name: 2012-04 Asus Oplay IPTVList module
items.desc:
**IPTVList**

**Date:** 2012
**Platform:** Asus O!Play media player
**Language:** xTreamer RSS

Module for **Asus O!Play** media player. It turns **Asus O!Play** into **IPTV player**.

This is an IPTV playlist with a modern, user-friendly interface, easy navigation, and support for recording TV programs. The GUI is styled after the PlayOn! firmware skin.

[Discussion thread on moservices.org forums](https://moservices.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=5&t=1535)

**Asus O!Play** is now completely outdated.

This folder contains my hobby projects (programming) released to public.

I also maintain a number of open-source projects on Github currently.

Streaming and effective reading from DVD disk (translated to english)
Optimizing Xenus 2 for multicore CPUs (translated to english)
Vital Engine ZL Non Moving Objects animation

items.desc:
**Vital Engine ZL** is Game Engine developed by **Sergey Zabaryansky** and **Roman Lut**. This game engine was used in:

[Venom: Codename Outbreak](/?start=2&folder=Work_projects%2F2001-08_Venom_Codename_Outbreak)
[Xenus: Boiling Point](/?start=2&folder=Work_projects%2F2005-05_Xenus_Boiling_Point)
[Xenus 2: Road To Hell](/?start=2&folder=Work_projects%2F2008-10_Xenus_2_White_Gold)
[The Partisans](/?start=2&folder=Work_projects%2F2010-01_The_Partisans_Prototype)

We started engine development in 1998 and created a technical demo showcasing the engine‚Äôs graphics and physics features. With this demo, we approached **GSC Game World**, where **Venom** was developed and released.

After the release of **Venom**, we left **GSC Game World** and founded our own company, **Deep Shadows**, where **Xenus**, **Xenus 2**, and **The Precursors** were developed and released.

Due to a crisis in the game industry, development of **Vital Engine ZL** was stopped in 2010.

items.name: 2001-08 Venom Codename Outbreak
items.desc:
**Codename: Outbreak** (known as **Venom. Codename: Outbreak in Ukraine and Russia**) is a first-person shooter video game developed by **GSC Game World** and published by **Virgin Interactive**.

The game was developed by core team of 4 people, 8 people at peak.

**My role**: Graphics Engine programming, Level Editor/Tools programming, Level Design.

[Codename Outbreak on Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Codename%3A_Outbreak)

items.name: 2005-05 Xenus Boiling Point
items.desc:
**Boiling Point: Road to Hell** (**Xenus: –¢–æ—á–∫–∞ –∫–∏–ø–µ–Ω–∏—è**, **Xenus: Boiling Point**) is a 2005 first-person shooter game developed by Ukrainian game studio **Deep Shadows** and published by **Atari**. Boiling Point's gameplay is a combination of first-person shooter and role-playing video game mechanics, set in an open world. 

The game was developed by core team of 15 people, 25 people at peak.

**My role**: Lead Graphics Engine programming, Level Editor/Tools programming.

[Boiling Point: Road To Hell on Wikipeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boiling_Point:_Road_to_Hell)

items.name: 2008-10 Xenus 2 White Gold
Lecture Optimizing Xenus 2 For Multicore CPUs

items.desc:
**White Gold: War in Paradise** (**Xenus II: –ë–µ–ª–æ–µ –∑–æ–ª–æ—Ç–æ**, **Xenus II: White Gold**) is the sequel or possibly prequel to the 2005 video game [Boiling Point: Road to Hell](http://localhost:5173/?start=2&folder=Work_Projects%2F2005-05_Xenus_Boiling_Point). **White Gold** was developed by Ukrainian game studio **Deep Shadows**. 

**Xenus** gameplay is a combination of first-person shooter and role-playing video game mechanics, set in an open world. 

The game was developed by core team of 15 people, 30 people at peak.

**My role**: Lead Graphics Engine programming, Level Editor/Tools programming, XBOX 360 port.

In 2009, **Deep Shadows** had working XBOX 360 prototype. Due to a crysis in the game industry in 2009, XBOX 360 development was cancelled.

**Xenus 2** is the best game by **Deep Shadows**. I am proud to have been a core member of the **Xenus 2** development team. I truly love this game and would still play it with the same excitement even after 20 years.

[Xenus: White Gold](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_Gold:_War_in_Paradise) on Wikipedia.

[Xenus: White Gold](https://store.steampowered.com/app/546230/Xenus_2_White_gold/) on Steam.

items.name: 2009-10 The Precursors
items.desc:
**The Precursors** is a 2009 first-person shooter game developed by Ukrainian game studio **Deep Shadows**. The game was released for Windows in Russia on 4 December 2009. It was then released worldwide through GamersGate on 21 December 2010 and through Steam on 4 February 2017. 

The Precursors is a sci-fi game that combines shooting, RPG, and space simulation in an open galaxy. Players explore four main planets and several space locations, complete quests, and fight enemies on foot and in space. 

The game was developed by core team of 15 people, 30 people at peak.

Due to a crysis in the game industry in 2009, it required a great effort to release this game.

**My role**: Lead Graphics Engine programming, Level Editor/Tools programming.

[The Precursors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Precursors) on Wikipedia.

items.name: 2010-01 The Partisans Prototype
items.desc:
**The Partisans** is a first-person shooter game developed by Ukrainian game studio **Deep Shadows** for PC and XBOX 360. The game was cancelled because **Deep Shadows** was not able to find funding due to crysis in the game industry in 2009.

The prototype was developed by a team of 5 people.

**My role**: Lead Graphics Engine programming, Level Editor/Tools programming.

items.name: 2011-04 Exorcist
items.desc:
Ôªø**Exorcist**
Hidden Object Game developed by **Deep Shadows**.

**My Role:** Hidden Object Game Engine design, Scenes and Animation editor.
**Platform:** Windows
**Language:** C++


In 2011, **Deep Shadows** switched to the hidden object games genre. Before leaving the company, I developed the tools and game engine for this direction within a few months.

Several other games have been developed using this engine:


Insider Tales: The Stolen Venus 2 (2011)

items.name: 2018-2020 Unity RPG NDA
items.desc:
**Training application**

I worked on a personnel training application for a well-known brand (NDA), delivered as a 3D FPS/RPG experience in a photorealistic environment.

The application featured extensive interactive dialogues, where facial animation was a core component. We developed a neural-network‚Äìbased tool for automatic recognition of phonemes, head and body poses, and eyebrow movements from recorded actor videos, enabling realistic character animation during conversations.

**Platform:** PC, iPad
**Language:** C++, C#
**My Role:** Unity developer, tools development

items.name: 2022-2025 FinConPro
items.desc:
**FinConPro and MyLifePlan**


**FinConPro** is a Swiss all-in-one financial advisory software that combines CRM, wealth management, and pension and investment planning, designed for banks, advisors, and insurance professionals. It supports holistic financial planning, customer onboarding, and lifecycle investment analysis in a compliant business platform. 
**MyLifePlan** is the individual-focused planning component that works with FinConPro to help create personalized long-term financial and life goals.

**Platform:** HTML5
**Language:** Typescript, Angular framework
**My role:** Frontend developer

[FinConPro website](https://finconpro.ch/en/home/)
[MyLifePlan website](https://ideaconseils.finconpro.ch/mylifeplan/)
This folder contains a list of most projects I have worked on during my career.
